intro: Cineraria mitellifolia, commonly known as the Canary Island cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and the flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Cineraria mitellifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and coastal landscapes.
